reviews.sentence: Amazing hotel. First time staying here and was immediately impressed upon check in with the glass of proseco and some unique smell in the air in the lobby which I could not wait to smell every time I returned to the hotel during my stay. Staff was over the top nice everyone had smiles on their faces everyone knew your name even the cleaning staff turned off vacuums down the hall so you did not have to listen to them as you walked to your room. Rooms were clean bright comforatable. Food was great drinks were strong. Order the cheesecake or the homemade chips for a snack. I had fly back to California just for those snacks there.

Boutique hotel perfect place to stay. After a weeks tour from San Francisco driving then all the way down the coast this was the perfect resting place for our final week. The rooms were spacious a beautiful bathroom with full size toiletries I was delighted as my pet hate is having to ask for replacements when you are staying in the hotel for several nights. Good food and complimentary coffee self service in the trendy bar in the morning. Service at breakfast was rather sullen not very friendly and does need improving. Small pool great club atmosphere so not good if you want complete peace but we all loved it.

Honeymoon Treat. For our last night of a California road trip we returned to our favourite place Santa Monica. We decided to splash out and treat ourselves to a nights stay at the Viceroy. Greeted on arrival with valet parking. Situated on the main strip with views out to the pier and famous beach. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The room was spacious and we had a view over the pool at the rear of the hotel. All the furnishings were of the highest quality and the complimentary bath toiletries went down very well with the wife. Highly recommended.

First Visit to Santa Monica. One block from the ocean with a lovely water view from our room. Warm welcome from the stafVery trendy and lovely décor in the lobby restaurant and bar. Pool with curtained cabanas andpalm trees visible through the lobby. Complimentary bicycles for the bike path along the beach. Loved this hotel and would definitely go back.

Vibrant hotel in a good location. Ultimately chose this property based on location which is very central. Rooms were nice clean and spacious with ocean views. Beautiful bathroom with vanity. I appreciated the free coffee bar set up in the mornings by the elevators. The service was not over the top but all our needs were met. Definitely a scene in the lobby and many meetings taking place around the pool area during the week.

Worth every penny. The Viceroy in Santa Monica is across the street from the beach. For us this is heaven. While the Viceroy is pricey it is well worth it. The Viceroy made our stay in Santa Monica wonderful a truly relaxing vacation. Upon check in the valet service was friendly and helpful we were greeted with complimentary sparkling wine in the lobby and were lucky enough to score an ocean view room. There was no pressure to utilize the service of the hotel porter and we did not. There is a service fee which at first seemed unfair until we borrowed bicycles to ride along the beach paths. The Viceroy has a beautiful pool area where you can sit and hang out have drinks or dine at the hotel restaurant. We did not have breakfast or dine there. The Viceroy is across the street from the consummate Santa Monica breakfast joint Coras Coffee Shope. The Viceroy was our home base convenient to by car some of LAs premier arts institutions great restaurants and interesting neighborhoods.

I done came up like 7 UP. This hotel features very luxurious accommodations for a pretty decent price. Considering we had ocean view and were just a couple of blocks from the beach. Big plus to be on Ocean Avenue. The Viceroy also gives an aire of old school royalty with the amount of fancy Europeans that were also guests at the hotel. We decided to try breakfast and lunch at least once at the hotel given that we were around some of the most amazing places to eat in the world. Breakfast and lunch were both excellent. The eggs benedict called something else were delightful. And the sandwich at lunch delectable. The pool was great but the service not so much. We were left several times for half an hour or more without ever being asked if we needed anything. This must of have been a busy day because every other aspect of the service here was exquisite. The Viceroy offers bicycles to their guests to enjoy during the day. Every single day we tried to get one but were unsuccessful. I am not a fan of what some people were doing which was to hide a bicycle between cars in the parking lot or in the bushes. Since I have to go outside often to smoke I saw people doing that and I just find it stupid silly and completely arrogant. Nevertheless the hotel should work on that because we never got to use the bicycles. The one day we did go down early there was a large group getting bikes. The room was plush and elegant. that is the best I can do to describe it. The shower bath and bed were out of this world good. The rooms are a good size too. Typically in these boutique hotels the rooms can be small but the Viceroy did not disappoint.

The property was definitely too expensive for what you get. The “ ocean view ” room was mediocre at best with most blocked by buildings. The room had AC rattling all night long which kept us up. I was offered two free beverages with VIP amenities and they gave us a tiny bottle of water each upon check in which I ’m sure every guest receives. Would n’t stay here again.

Nice place a bit expensive for what it is. You pay for the location. Hotel facilities were nice everything look clean and modern. Pillows at the room where amazing. Soft and big. We stayed for 3 days and 2 of them had private events at the pool terrace area and no guest could use that area. It was very bad because we were looking forward on using the pool and coudnt do it 2 days.

I am a fan. I have stayed here a few times for business. I had another great experience this most recent stay. My room was big cool decor. Very comfy bed nice TV. Very quiet nights sleep. The outdoor space is really tranquil. Lobby bar is cool and fun. Good service during every interaction during my 4 day stay. One tiny criticism my bathroom sink was really small I had to squeeze against the wall to see myself in the mirror. But I am really reaching to criticize at all. I had def stay here again.

Decent. Location was great staff were really nice and the room had a window that opened almost into a balcony. Everything was under renovations which we were not told before our stay. This meant the big lobby and whole pool area were closed down. The room was also smaller than the pictures made it look.

I ’ve stayed at the Viceroy Santa Monica many times. The location is great staff helpful usually there is a cool vibe to the hotel. This time I was disappointed to arrive find the property under complete renovation. I booked in mid December renovation started first week of January. I feel expedia Viceroy should have disclosed before I booked that the hotel lobby pool restaurant etc were under complete renovation would be inaccessible. The hotel is doing what it can to make the renovation tolerable eg offering complimentary pastries coffee in the morning. However it was quite a shock to arrive with it under construction i would not have booked had i known that.

Excellent. I liked the property but. But now they are construction going on. I did not know until checked inThat ’s was shocked. I understood that they need to rework the new lobby and garden terrace. next time will be beautiful to stay in.

Too many little issues. The reason for my mid level review is there were too many little issues that just hindered our stay. We stayed over Christmas NYLocation is great close to the shops restaurants and the beach. Hotel is modern and boutique style a little tired in places. The room was comfortable sound proofing was not great you can hear everything. Beds were small and water pressure in the shower was not good plus the plug did not work so no bath for the kids. As for the pool TINY looks so much bigger in the pictures I would not want to be there in the summer I can image it would be like a can or sardinesService was generally great restaurant and bar staff went above and beyond reception and concierge not so much. When we checked in we were offered champagne but it never arrived were told we had qualified for an upgrade but that did not happen either. When I enquired about the morning yoga sessions that were advertised I was told they were not running this week. Also when looking for deals from the concierge we were told she could get us discounts at Universal and for a Lakers game turned out that was not the case and we got them cheaper booking ourselves online. We had a great stay and the location was great but as I said lots of silly little issues.

Good lord. Too pricey for what this place offers. Pros •. The place had posh lounging areas cool. •. The receptionists and desk was a nice experience because the staff were very cordial polite and well dressed. •. The bathrooms were nice. It had a vanity with a chair. Cons. •. The room was small •. The walls are so thin you can understand what the next occupied room were talking about. •. Some of the occupants were loud in the hallway so early in the morning too. •. The king bed was HARD and uncomfortable to lay in it felt like you were on a box spring with a thin topper mattress pad. •. The comforter was so crinkly it was like covering yourself with newspaper. It just crinkle crinkle crinkles. every time you moved OMG. I was not able to sleep at all it was annoying.

MR DAUVERS at viceroy. Actually the hotel should have been closed during works as charging 50 usd per nights with zero facilities is outrageous. No restaurant pool closed. Only 1 hall to go to the room. And not people making you stay better. Ghost hotel.

Terrible service during construction not worth one star. I am staying at the hotel for two nights for a business trip. Hotel is under construction which I did not know when booking through my companys travel site. I was notified there is no amenities available at the moment upon arrival which I understood and am fine with. There is a notification in the front desk and in the room to indicate that construction work starts at 9 am Monday to Friday. This morning 217 some work started before 8 am and full blast work started at 8 am. I am in a room facing the back yard and pool and I can see workers working in the pool who are making the noises. I went to the front desk and asked why they are starting work at 8 am vs 9 am written on the paper right on the front desk. The front desk person went to ask the manager and came to tell me that they are trimming the trees vs construction. I told her i can see them working in the pool. She then went to get the manager who came out and admitted the noise was from construction. It is unethical for someone to run a luxury hotel by lying to its customers to their face. The hotel charges 300 a night. it is bad enough that there is no amenities whatsoever. Then start construction early and lie about it is just unacceptable. I am going to send a note to recommend removing this hotel from our hotel list. There are much better hotels to stay in with much better services than this.

Poor decision. We had no idea the hotel was under complete renovations until our friend arrived a day in advance. Given the rates charged I assumed there would still be some amenities like at least a bar but there is nothing. Could n’t get a hit shower in the room or even a water station in their “ lounge ”. Too many other hotels around to make this a choice.

BEWARE Fyre Festival of Hotels. Honestly never ever stay here again. Not only is the hotel under complete renovation and is a construction site offers nothing but an elevator to the room. These are not minor enhancements it should be illegal to have a hotel open under complete construction especially a hotel this ilk. They actually tried to charge me a resort fee when there was no resort so the effort alone in fighting charges after they ruined my weekend was draining. When I asked for the manager to contact me nothing happened and they honestly could not have cared less.
Excellent on all vounts. Overall experience was very good staff were exceptional and we would both return and recommend to friends. That we missed the upgraded facilities but next time.
